comments:
This course discusses mathematical concepts and techniques that are especially relevant to computer science. Topics include propositional logic, inference, sets, functions and relations, sequences and summations, induction principles, recursion, combinatorics and graph theory, and practice in writing and reading mathematical proofs.

Many students felt the class provided a “valuable” mathematical background for future computer classes, though some considered the amount of new content to be insubstantial.

Some students praised Professor Nenkova as “accommodating” and “thorough,” but many others criticized her communication skills and felt she was unable or unwilling to listen to student input.

Students with a mathematical background often found this class to be “easy,” repetitive, and slow. Students without a mathematical background found it to be significantly more challenging, but were more likely to value the course content.
